data.text: A generally disk-shaped fastener used to join two parts of a garment by fitting through a buttonhole or loop.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Such an object used for decoration.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Any of various objects resembling a button, especially.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The blunt tip of a fencing foil.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A fused metal or glass globule.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: In graphical user interface systems, a well-defined area within the interface that is clicked to select a command.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: In a hypertext database, an icon that when selected allows a user to view a particular associated object.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
